result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek John Bregovits was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence

Payment of DNA surcharge only - due within 90 day of being released from initial confinement in 2CF57 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
All other fines and costs are remitted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek John Bregovits

11:01 AM Defendant Derek John Bregovits in court, in custody.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Derek John Bregovits.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews support letters.

Deft heard.

Court imposes on Count 1 of 22CF33:
6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence.
Credit for 180 days time served.
Remit fines and costs.
Payment of DNA surcharge only = $200 due within 90 days of being released from initial confinement in 22CF57 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 10-26-2022
Court imposes on Count 1 of 22CF57:
2 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, consecutive to 22CF33 and any other sentence.
Eligible for CIP and SAP.
Conditions of extended supervision:
Remit fines & costs.
Payment of DNA surcharge only = $250 - payable from available prison monies.
Repayment of $185 buy money - payable from available prison monies.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users or dealers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and following through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-26-2022
